page.description: Returns the minimum value of matching records in a specified table.
page.syntax: Smallest_Of_Values as N = DBMIN(C tablename,C tagname,A keyvalue,C field)

argument.name: tablename
argument.description: The full drive, path, name, and extension of the table. If you omit the drive, path, and extension, Alpha Anywhere searches the directory of the current table.

argument.name: keyvalue
argument.description: An explicit value or the name of a field in the table containing a value. Any type

argument.name: field
argument.description: An expression based on character, date, numeric, or exponent numeric field(s) in the Lookup_Table.

page.discussion: DBMIN() searches the specified Lookup_Table for one or more records with the specified Key_Value, and returns the smallest value of the values contained in Lookup_Expression. Note : If no records with matching key values are found, Alpha Anywhere returns a zero value.
